synthesis_conditions.product: (TMA)2[(UO2)4(ox)4L] (1, TMA+ = tetramethylammonium cation, ox = oxalate, L = succinate)
synthesis_conditions.framework_description: 3D framework constructed by connection via organic moieties in L ligand
synthesis_conditions.pore_contents: TMA+ cations located in the pores balancing the anionic charge of the framework

irradiation_experiments.equipment: RS-2000 Pro Biological Irradiator with Cu Ka radiation source
Gamma cell 1000 Elite/3000 Elan Irradiator with 137Cs source

synthesis_conditions.quenching_observation: Significant photoluminescence quenching after exposure to 40 Gy of X-ray or 60 Gy of g-ray
synthesis_conditions.recovery_method: Heating the irradiated sample at 200 88C for 12 h

synthesis_conditions.radical_generation: C=O double bond in the carboxylate group partially breaks forming an oxygen-based radical
synthesis_conditions.radical_stabilization: Substantially stabilized in the conjugated uranyl oxalate-carboxylate sheet
synthesis_conditions.EPR_analysis: Confirms the radicals generated and their long-term stability at room temperature

materials.name: Radiation Dosimeter Sensitivity and Detection Limit

synthesis_conditions.sensitivity: After exposure to only 0.12 Gy g-ray, the emission of 1 decreased about 20.3%
synthesis_conditions.recyclability: Demonstrated by multiple cycles of irradiation/heating procedure
